greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (theta_4(q^3)^2 - theta_4(q)^2)/4 in powers of q.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: Expansion of eta(q) * eta(q^3) * eta(q^12)^3 /(eta(q^4) * eta(q^6)^2) in powers of q.
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = -1 if e > 0, a(3^e) = (-1)^e, a(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4), a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4).
mathematica: eta[q_]:= q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[eta[q]* eta[q^3]*eta[q^12]^3/(eta[q^4]*eta[q^6]^2), {q, 0, 100}], q]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 19 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)^3 / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^2), n))};
xref: Apart from signs, same as A035154 and A113446.
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 30 2006
